video.copyright:
Tony Shawcross explains Creative Commons licensing

This movie is part of the collection: Denver Open Media

Creative Commons license: Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States

params.text: A "non commercial outlet" may be loosely described as a place that distributes something without charging money.
Creative Commons may be used for any intellectual property like images, texts, animations etc.

params.question: Which of these are typical Creative Commons terms?

summaries: Traditional copyright restrict the sharing of your content
Traditional copyright allow others to share your content as long as they don't get paid.
You still have the copyright after releasing content under Creative Commons license
If you release content under a Creative Commons license you may no longer release the same content under a different license.
Creative commons allow others to use your video as long as they follow the stipulations you set forward
Creative Commons allow others to use your videos as long as the don't use them for commercial purposes
